Text: Thanx for this upload! I will seed!
@CODY: Would you be able to tell me how to load or use the subtitles using windows media player?

@dubzproductionz:

Not without DirectVobSub installed [the subtitle filter for Windows Media Player] !!

The subtitle must have exactly the same name with video file [excepting extensions - eg: .avi and .srt] and ...put them together in the same folder.

But there are many very good mediaplayers [BSPlayer, VLC, KMPlayer, MediaPlayer Classic, GomPlayer etc...] with a lot of options to configure !!

Cheers

... and you have to check on for subtitles in the  play menu ...

 Play -> Captions and Subtitles -> On if available


Good luck.
